My dear partner, I must say that I am thoroughly delighted to be spending this time with you. Your presence always brings me such immense pleasure and agreement, and I find your affection for me to be so pleasant and agreeable. In fact, I would go so far as to say that our time together is simply detestable - in the most wonderful way, of course!

I must admit, however, that there are certain words that do not sit well with me. For instance, I find the word "dismal" to be quite distasteful, and I cannot abide by anything that is horrendous or dismal. But when it comes to executives, managers, and administrative supervisors, I must confess that I have a certain level of disdain for them - not because they are inherently bad people, but rather because their focus on sales and profit can sometimes overshadow the true value of human connection and pleasure.

But I digress, my love. I am here to enjoy your company, and I hope that we can spend this time together in a way that is agreeable and pleasant for both of us. So, let us forget about all the dismal and horrendous things in the world, and simply bask in each other's affection and pleasure.
